issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

comments.body: [~ajisakaa]: Can you help [~xianyuxiaoer2] to review the patch?
I have changed the status to "Patch Available" and seems not trigger HADOOP-QA to test.How can i trigger HADOOP-QA ?

Now we cannot trigger the precommit job. It is reported that Hadoop jenkins jobs can kill the node.

In HDFS-12711:
bq. FYI: Reducing the number of nodes that HDFS, HADOOP, and Hadoop's QBT jobs may run on to reduce the impact to the rest of the ASF.
[~ajisakaa]: the way to let HADOOP-QA to run jenkins is getting +1 from hadoop committer?
No, +1 is unrelated. Now we are in trouble and there is no way to run Hadoop QA.
Reattaching the same patch file so  can hit the submit plugin. Let's see whet happens. FWIW, I'm happy with this as long as it still works on Java 8.
